    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UnboundedInt()
      No-arg constructor initilizes UnboundedInt to "0"
      UnboundedInt​(java.lang.String input)
      Pulls apart the String "input" into nodes of 3 digits, each representing an increasing significance (ex : "358459145" translates to [145]->[459]->[358] )

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      UnboundedInt add​(UnboundedInt given)
      Adds two UnboundedInts and returns the sum as a new UnboundedInt
      java.lang.Object clone()
      Clone method to clone an UnboundedInt object.
      boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Equals method determines if two UnboundedInt objects are equal to one another
      UnboundedInt multiply​(UnboundedInt given)
      Multiplies to UnboundedInt objects and stores the result in a new UnboundedInt
      UnboundedInt shift​(UnboundedInt given, int topCount, int bottomCount)
      "Shifts" the UnboundedInt by adding a zero to the front of the list, to represent a place holder (ex : if [437] is meant to represent 437,000, shift adds 0 to the front of the node, [000]->[437] )
      void start()
      Places the cursor at the first node in the UnboundedInt (the least significant digits)
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints the UnboundedInt object as a string with commas and the correct number of zero's

    • Field Detail

      • totalNodes

        private int totalNodes
        Invariant of the UnboundedInt class: 1. "totalNodes" represents the amount of nodes in the UnboundedInt 2. "front" refers to the front of the list (note - this would mean the least significant value--ex: 18,965 is stored as [965]->[018] ) 3. "cursor" is used as an iterator, and represents the current node 4. "back" refers to the tail of the list (note - this would mean the most significant value) 5. each IntNode contains 1 to 3 digits, the max value being 999, "NODE_MAX" is set to one more than this to make loops easier to read

        private IntNode front

        private IntNode cursor

      • UnboundedInt

        public UnboundedInt​(java.lang.String input)
        Pulls apart the String "input" into nodes of 3 digits, each representing an increasing significance (ex : "358459145" translates to [145]->[459]->[358] )
        Parameters:
        String - input the number to be represented as the new UnboundedInt

      • shift

        public UnboundedInt shift​(UnboundedInt given,
                          int topCount,
                          int bottomCount)
        "Shifts" the UnboundedInt by adding a zero to the front of the list, to represent a place holder (ex : if [437] is meant to represent 437,000, shift adds 0 to the front of the node, [000]->[437] )
        Parameters:
        UnboundedInt - given the UnboundedInt needing adjustment
        Returns:
        UnboundedInt result The altered UnboundedInt
